content.description: Climb the right side of the West Face slab. It's about 5.7.

Start from a large incut jug and lieback up the arete using a slanting seam/crack on the right. Balancy with good body positioning required.

A SDS can be done at about V3.
content.protection: Pad, spotter to keep you off the rock to the right.
content.location: On the Northeast corner of the boulder.

content.description: Start off a small shelf and lieback the obvious hole as you highstep into it. Once established work up and right on large incuts with smears for your feet to an easy topout.
content.location: On the Southeast corner of the boulder at an obvious hole in the rock.

content.description:
Start up

Descent Route

for a few moves and then work left along a sloping ledge to an obvious heart-shaped depression in the rock. From here continue up the smooth slab above with edges appearing just when you need them.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Backside of the boulder and 20' right of

Stand Up for Your Rights

.

content.description: Start with a high crimp for the left hand and a small sharp sidepull for the right, work your feet up high on marginal smears and go big up and left for a huge undercling/jug. Work your feet up again and mantle over the rounded top to finish.
content.location: Center of the South Face, behind the bicycle rack.

content.description: Climb up/down the Northwest corner. It's about 5.6.

A classic run and jump problem.  The V6 rating is not mine, but has been tossed about.  As far as jump problems go, this one is pretty hard and is probably J2+.  It is harder than the run and jump on Streetcar Named Desire, and miles harder than the Jump Chump.

Start well back from the South, and then sprint headlong at the boulder, trying to launch up and right to the obvious patina rail that is high above.  Finish up and right on easy ground.

Here is a video link to "The Driver" trying this problem in the '80's.

fishproducts.com/movies/driâ€¦
content.protection: Boulder problem, with cat like skills your only protection.  A pad at the base may affect your approach run, and for sure removes style points.
content.location: On the front (South) face of the Entrance Boulder. Scramble off the back.
